definitions.definition: One of two options on a true-or-false test.
definitions.example: The student received a failing grade for circling every true and false on her quiz.

definitions.definition: Of a state in Boolean logic that indicates a negative result.
Not faithful or loyal, as to obligations, allegiance, vows, etc.; untrue; treacherous.
definitions.example: a false friend, lover, or subject;  false to promises

definitions.definition: Not well founded; not firm or trustworthy; erroneous.
definitions.example: a false conclusion;  a false construction in grammar

definitions.definition: Not essential or permanent, as parts of a structure which are temporary or supplemental.
Used in the vernacular name of a species (or group of species) together with the name of another species to which it is similar in appearance.
In a dishonest and disloyal way; falsely.
